Description: Part of a jar-seal: slightly baked red by fire, bearing an impressed inscription showing the repeated name of Djer. On the edge of the fragment is a small part of another inscription, giving the name of the official, Hemaka.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls.XV, 122; H. R. Hall, 'Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs etc. in the British Museum: Volume 1 : Royal scarabs' (London, 1913), 288, no.2758; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964), pls.14, abb.29D; 32, abb. 96; see also vols. I, 76 and II, 686, n.44; 737 n.334; 1096, 1106; B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' V (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 78.
